Before he could answer Kup, Tucson listens to the voice of the Matrix,Kup a=
nd to Lord Elder.  Once again they had caught him just in time to pull him =
from what could have been an emotional disaster.  He was thankful for that.=


" I guess I don't know the difference between being too self absorbed and=
 when it's all right to actually state how valuable one self is to a cause.=
  I have to stop doubting myself as far as worth is concerned. I'll kick my=
self in the aft to improve if I have to."  

He then thinks about his disab=
ility and pauses for just a moment.

" Well, now that I need to kind of cha=
nge gears for a moment, I suppose I should see myself as an innovator, who'=
s self worth is rather valuable to the cause of turning things around for e=
veryone and not just for himself.  I'm not saying I'm a God, and that to me=
 would be far too fetched.  But now, if I were to rate my self worth, I'd s=
ay my role as an Autobot is valuable.  If I had not persisted in trying to =
find out what happened to Rodimus, not only would I not have found him, I w=
ould not have been able to stop the same thing from happening to others.  A=
nd now that I do realize what's going on, and the fact that I could have ne=
arly fallen down the same path, which I hope never to do, thanks to all of =
you, and the voice I keep hearing, I can finally do some real good around h=
ere.  And I promise, I'll work with each and every one of you, to the best =
of my abilities,
and try to come up with new ways upon which to do so."

An=
other pause.

" Now that I've woken up a bit, I suppose I'd like to be able=
 to see again, I just haven't really gotten around to asking someone on how=
 to repair my visual circuitry... Heh, truth is, I'm one of the biggest pro=
crastinators on Cybertron.  I guess I've just been putting it off too long,=
 after getting used to not having my sight, it just became second nature to=
 me.  And in some respects, perhaps I did not want to actually "See" the tr=
uth of the situation.  And of course, major confession coming out here...  =
At the time, Ratchet was doing repairs and well I didn't want to burden him=
 with anything...  He had enough going on.  After a while I completely forg=
ot and then another major war happened and before I knew it I lost track of=
 time..  But now there is time for the repair.  I just need to have my circ=
uitry examined before it is repaired... I don't know the extend of my damag=
es truthfully.."

He sighs.

"I'm not good at tolerating bad news, you prob=
ably already know that."





--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carrol=
l <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > > What am I worth? How can I be worth so=
mething when there are lives just starting out there that are more precious=
 than my own? And how can I say I'm worth something when we have young aspi=
ring Autobots and Maximals just starting their careers as soldiers? They ha=
ve their whole lives ahead of them, and by Primus I'm prepared to give back=
 what's been taken from them, THEIR FREEDOM!"
> 
> "All sentient being have=
 worth young Tuscon." comes that whisper again
> as Tuscon positioned himse=
lf near to the body of Optimus. "If you do
> not count your self as worth a=
nything how can any one else see you as
> worthy of anything?"
> 
> Even as=
 the voice spoke to Tuscon, Lord Elder chimed in, unknowingly
> agreeing wi=
th the whispered voice, "You know, you sound like Rodimus.
> He used to say=
 things like that. He would get depressed when he
> failed. Even if he won =
the battle, he would sometimes find things that
> he missed."
> 
> "Yes Tus=
con" the whispered voice continued. "Do not tie your sense of
> self to you=
r successes, but to your efforts to achieve that success.
> Who you are def=
ines your value, not what you have you have achieved."
> 
> Another whisper=
ed voice, also presumably from the Matrix inside
> Optimus, "Tell me someth=
ing Tuscon, we are not biological creatures
> but technological, yet you ar=
e blind, why have you chosen to remain
> so? could it be because you choose=
 to remember the pain of loss or
> failure?"
> 
> Another voice whispered t=
o Tuscon, this one sounding a little like
> Optimus himself, "Do not make t=
he mistake that Rodimus has made. He
> lost the energy matrix and himself i=
n that loss. He will need your
> help to remember his own value. Only then =
can the power of the matrix
> help him. But first *you* must see his value,=
 and your own."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
